<<Budget>>

I'm Tashieka and you selected me as your personal coach. 

This is the added bonus of using MBC, you get access to me and my virtual avatar.

<<Budget>>


I am a busy mama of 4 kiddos, a financial coach and educator and I want to help you learn how to create a plan for your money so you can have clarity and confidence towards a life of freedom.

I created this avatar to help you navigate and create your spending plan (aka budget).

<<Budget>>


Think of this avatar as your fairy budget guide, helping you budget your way to financial clarity.

<<Budget>>


Because this is only an avatar you can't really chat with me in realtime via this software.
I understand

<<Budget>>


However, if you have questions or need support, you can schedule a meeting with me, the real Tashieka, I am just a Zoom call away.  

This will be an additional cost in addition to the monthly fee
I'm here for it!

<<Budget>>

Welcome to MyBudgetCoach,[[user_first_name]]!

MyBudgetCoach (MBC) is a unique budgeting software to help you learn to budget, with the support of a personal coach, so you can gain clarity and take control of your money.
No, I don't
Yes, I do.

<<Budget>>

Before we jump into the numbers, take a second to think about your ideal life and the goals you want to achieve.
Do you have a financial goal?
move_to: zoom_link
Ok, got it!

Next

If you have a CREDIT on your card, enter the balance as a POSITIVE number.  (Note: this is rare)

Add Transaction

We will review how to 1) Add transactions and 2) Key budget skills for your success.

I selected the box
I deleted the transaction

<<Accounts>>

To the right hand side of the search box, select the purple text with '1 transaction' to see a series of options.

Select 'Delete' to remove that transaction.

 if you accidentally click something else you can always undo something, press Control + Z on a PC or Command + Z on a Mac.OR you an hit the 'Undo" button in the options below the account balance.

<<Budget>>

This is the budget table.

Think of it as a digital cash envelope system.

The Category Groups and Categories will be designed to help you gain clarity and take control of your money.

<<Budget>>

The Category column houses the names of each category. We will work on customizing this is a bit.

<<Budget>>

The Budgeted column is where you'll be budgeting your dollars. This shows you what you have allocated each month for the categories.

<<Budget>>

Next up is the Spent column. This shows you what you've actually spent out of the budgeted dollars.

<<Budget>>

The last column is Balance. This value shows you what you have available to spend. 
If it's NEGATIVE and red, you've overspent in this category. 

If the amount is POSITIVE and black, that's what you have available.

<<Budget>>

If this number is negative, be sure to address it and cover this overspending.  

If not taken care of you either risk over-drafting your checking account or adding debt to your credit card. 
We'll discuss more about this later.

<<Budget>>

Let's take a look at these three dots next to Category. This gives you visual options.

Show hidden categories: Allows you to show and hide categories

Expand all: This will expand the category groups.

Collapse all: This will collapse the category groups.

<<Budget>>

Voila!  Your category groups have been added.

1)Investments and Savings
2) Fixed and Recurring Bills
3) Debt
4) Non-Monthly Expenses
5) Variable Expenses

Now let's review each Category Group and it's purpose.
I need 5 minutes
Let's continue

<<Budget>>

But before we do. Pulse check.

Do you need a break or are you good to continue setting up your plan?
I'm back

<<Budget>>

No worries, I'll be here after your break.

<<Budget>>

Investments and Savings: This Category Group is listed first because it's important to prioritize YOU and set aside money to build your financial foundation.

This category is for your savings goals.

<<Budget>>

Under each Category Group you will have Categories for your individual expenses.

For example, right now you see 'Savings' listed under Investments and Savings.

You can Add or Rename the categories to a name that aligns with your savings goal (i.e. Emergency, Freedom, FU Fund, Retirement)

<<Budget>>

Let's try it now.  Under the Investments and Savings Group, hover your mouse pointer over the 'Savings' category.

Click the down arrow and select 'Rename'. 

You can now type to rename your savings to your savings goal name.

Did you notice from the drop down you can 'Hide,' 'Rename,; or 'Delete' a Category?

<<Budget>>

Are you ready for another break?
I'm back

<<Budget>>

Cool, let's take 5 and let me know when you're back.
Let's do it!

<<Budget>>

 Great, let's learn how to set up your accounts!

<<Budget>>

Next we''ll go ahead and add your spending plan (aka budget) groups and walk you through the functions.

When setting up your spending plan, you'll want to organize your expenses into groups to give you more clarity and control of your money.

<<Budget>>

Fixed and Recurring Bills: This category group is for monthly fixed and recurring expenses that have a due date (aside from certain debts). 


Debt: This category group is for debts like your credit card, student loans, personal loans, and other debts.  These are debts that do not have an asset of value (i.e. home, car) associated with it. 


Non-Monthly Expenses: This category group is for expenses that do not occur on a monthly basis.  They may occur quarterly, semi-annually, or annually.  Think birthdays, holidays, insurance premiums, travel, etc.


Variable Expenses: These expenses do NOT have a due date and the expenses depend on your lifestyle.  This category group is where you have the most control of your money.
Budget Set-up
I clicked the third calendar icon

<<Budget>>

Let's review the calendar icons.  Here you can review and compare several months at once.

This will help you see your budget trends over time.

Let's try it out. Click the third calendar icon.

<<Budget>>

Now you can view three months. Let's change the view so you can see a different set of months using the purple selection. Click on a different month to see another set of months.

Now click back on the current month that is in bold.
move_to: months_band

<<Budget>>

Below the current month, I want you to see the amount labeled "To Budget."
move_to: budget_header

<<Budget>>

As you are learning MyBudgetCoach, I want you to focus on the amount 'To Budget' for now.
move_to: calendar_icons
Done, only one month is showing

<<Budget>>

highlight: budget_table
highlight: category_column

highlight: spent_column
highlight: category_column
highlight: balance_column

<<Budget>>

Alright, we are making progress!
Budget Skills

<<Budget>>

A few things to note:  MyBudgetCoach uses a zero-based budgeting approach.  So you can only budget with the dollars you actually have.  


This budgeting method ensures that every dollar has a name and that you do not overbudget which runs the risk of over drafting your accounts or going into debt with your credit cards.

<<Accounts>>

Great!
Now, let's jump back to the Budget screen and work on your budgeting skills
I didn't add any credit cards
I added one or more credit cards

<<Budget>>

Look at the “To Budget” number this is the amount you have available to pay your expenses.  


If this number is NEGATIVE, take a breath.  


I am going to walk you through how to work with your numbers, especially if you have a credit card balance.

<<Budget>>

And that's a wrap!  You made it through the budgeting tutorial.

Done. But I have more credit cards

<<Budget>>

In your budget, go to the Debt Category Group and Rename the “Credit Card” to your credit card name.
All credit cards have been added as a Category

<<Budget>>

Ok,  Continue by adding additional Categories under the Debt Category group for each credit card and enter the Credit Card account name for New Category Name.

Let me know when all credits cards have a Category named after it under the Debt Category Group.

<<Budget>>

Excellent!

When we set up your credit cards, if you have a balance due this balance will be included in your ‘To Budget’.  


So to correct this.  Go to your credit card category and in the “Budgeted” Column enter you credit card balance as a negative number for each Credit Card Category

<<Budget>>

Now, lets talk about prioritizing your "To Budget" dollars.

If you try to enter in the Budgeted for all your expenses for the month, you may end up with a NEGATIVE "To Budget" number. 

Therefore, based on your pay frequency, set up time each payday to plan your dollars.

If you get paid bi-weekly, set up your budget to allocate your paycheck to your expenses that fall within the first part of the month or the period of expenses between your paychecks

Then when your next paycheck comes, you will allocate your "To Budget" dollars to the remaining expenses.
Got it.

<<Budget>>

Alright, Now you will see your true “To Budget” number reflected.


The best way to budget with your credit card is to only use your credit card for items that are within your budget AND to pay your balance in full each month.


If you have questions or need more guidance around this topic, please schedule a Zoom session and I can dive deeper to support you.
highlight: budgeted_column

<<Budget>>

We are now at the end of the tutorial.

You can always 'Reset' this tutorial and go back through at any time by clicking 'Manage Coach' and then click Reset Coach.

But one last thing before I leave you...

<<Budget>>

If you have budgeted for all of your expenses and there is money still left in "To Budget". Click on the Purple 'To Budget' Balance and you will have the following options:

Move to a category:  This will allow you to Transfer money a category of your choice.  You can do this if the Balance in any category is Red.

Hold for next month: This will Zero out the "To Budget" dollars and put it in next month's "To Budget" bucket.

Reset next month's buffer: This will [What will this do?]

<<Budget>>

Now let's look at the balance column. If you have a NEGATIVE number in the Balance column for your categories.  You can click on the balance and see three options:

Transfer to another category: This allows you to transfer dollars one category to another category.

Rollover overspending: This will roll over your overspending to the next month.

Cover overspending:  This will allow you to transfer dollars from another category, that is positive, to cover the overspending.

<<Budget>>

If you move money that you didn't mean to move you can hit the "Undo" button above the Category column.


You can also remove any rollover overspending by clicking on the balance in the category and click "Remove overspending rollover"

Database - can keep responses and reference later on; not all questions need the database capture. The second line of the response selected is the database code. If not planning to reference answer later or drive flow based on response in another section, don't need second line.

<<Accounts>> / <<Budget>>

This aligns the avatar with which screen the user should be on. If a user goes to the Budget at a step where the avatar flow has <<Accounts>>, or if the user goes to an Account while the avatar is on Budget, the user will see the following message:

 Please navigate to the Accounts {Budget} to continue our conversation (please select an account).

Please Note: There needs to be a blank line between the reference to Accounts/Budget and the text shown in the avatar window.
Buttons can be short, default to 'Next' no text added on line, or even two sentences. Can also have multiple selections if asking a question.
Link to giphy: https://giphy.com/gifs/cbc-schittscreek-schitts-creek-3h4Bo5fja4ZgYS0WEg

Budget Table Overview

<<Budget>>

This is the budget table, basically a digital cash envelope system! You create categories relevant to your life and budget dollars accordingly.

<<Budget>>

The Category column houses the names of each category. We'll get customizing these in a bit.

<<Budget>>

The Budgeted column is where you'll be budgeting your dollars. This shows you what you have allocated each month for the categories.

<<Budget>>

Next up is the Spent column. This shows you what you've actually spent out of the budgeted dollars.

<<Budget>>

The last column is Balance. This shows you what you have available to spend. If it's negative and red, you've overspent in this category. If the amount is black, that's what you have available.

<<Budget>>

If you don't cover this overspending, you either risk over-drafting your checking account or adding debt to your credit card. More on this later!

<<Budget>>

Take a look at these three dots. This gives you visual options. You can collapse and expand category groups. You can also show and hide Hidden categories.

<<Budget>>

When you hover over a row, an arrow appears. You have options to add a category in this group, hide it, rename it or delete it.

<<Budget>>

Now, add a category to this group. Click that arrow again, and add a category. Choose a regular monthly bill you pay, such as your rent or mortgage.

<<Budget>>

This Account Set-Up section could be expanded. Could ask the user questions related to how many checking accounts / how many credit cards / the type of account structure the user has (joint / separate / single...)

The template has 
just one 'adding a transaction' example. However, you as the coach could use the credit cards question from before, to use the database to have additional sections for a credit card transaction, and walking through how a transfer (payment to a credit card) works in the bank account and credit card.
Trusting Your Numbers

One of the complexities for users with a zero-based budgeting software is the due diligence to ensure the account balances in MyBudgetCoach match the account balances in the financial institution. 

A difficult part of having the accounts match is ensuring the starting balance set by the user at the time the accounts are added are accurate. For checking accounts, some banks include pending transactions in the Current Balance. If the starting balance includes pending transactions, then when the transactions are added, they will be double counted. For credit cards, the Current Balance doesn't include pending transactions, so this is not an issue. 

Coach can consider consulting Coach Trainers to add a flow for verifying starting balance.
Coach should consider adding a flow for walking a user through how to link accounts with SimpleFin. Consult with Coach Trainers if interested in sample flow.
Consider having a question to create a break for the user. Could also reference the earlier list of steps to complete, and show progress by crossing out those pieces that are done.

User Survey after Tutorial
Credit Card Overview
Budget Skills

<<Budget>>

Close out the conversation

<<Budget>>

Remind about the booking a call

<<Budget>>

Coach option to offer email for users to contact you directly prior to a call. Could help with triaging if a call is needed, versus hopping on a call and then realizing there isn't enough information.

People who have Credit Card balances in excess of their available dollars in their checking account will have a negative amount To Budgeted. This is an important step for the user, but can be handled in a various number of ways. Consider the main steps the user needs to complete, and then determine as the coach if you want to add more detail for any of those steps:

1) Adding the Credit Card Category Group
2) Add a Category for each Credit Card
3) Changing the category on the account side of the Credit Card starting balance to the newly created Category
4) Rollover overspending if not going to pay off balance

This will give the user back their dollars in their checking account in the To Budgeted.

<<Budget>>

Insert warning for the To Budgeted amount for Credit Cards

Budget Setup

You as the Coach can do as much or as little as you would like for the user. For example, if you just want to add a handful of categories, or walk them through how to edit and add themselves, that is fine. Alternatively, you could have the system build an entire budget with defined groups, and categories, so when they select the button before the template is built, it automatically updates.

This is the end of the tutorial. Your coach avatar will come back if you program a trigger. Once you are a launched coach, reach out to Coach Trainers for additional steps to set-up a trigger for your avatar to re-join the user at certain times.

For example, 15th and 31st of the month to verify Budgeted down to $0 newly received income.
